qas.question: Who was the head of MCA in 1990?
What is the current name of the company that was called Matsushita Electric in 1990?
How much did Matsushita Electric pay for MCA?
In what year was MCA/Universal Home Video Inc. created?
What was the nationality of Matsushita Electric?
What company acquired MAC for $6.6 billion in 1990?
What was Matsushita Electric renamed in 1990?
What company created the VHS cassette?

context: Anxious to expand the company's broadcast and cable presence, longtime MCA head <a0_0>Lew Wasserman<a0_0/> sought a rich partner. He located <a4_0>Japanese<a4_0/> electronics manufacturer Matsushita Electric (now known as <a1_0><b5_0><b7_0>Panasonic<b7_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/>), which agreed to acquire MCA for <a2_0>$6.6 billion<a2_0/> in <a3_0>1990<a3_0/>. Meanwhile, around this time, the production subsidiary was renamed <b6_0>Universal Studios Inc<b6_0/>., and (in 1990) <b8_0>MCA<b8_0/> created MCA/Universal Home Video Inc. for the VHS video cassette (later DVD) sales industry.
